Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Style, sturdy build
Cons: Ridiculous price, terrible comfort, average sound quality, tricks people into thinking they're paying for the best.
First of let me say that I am a producer and a recording artist, as well as an audiophile. I'm writing this hoping to help people make an informed decision when it comes to purchasing headphones.
Basically, only buy Beat's if all you care about is style. If sound quality is a concern, you can get far superior sound from countless other headphones
When I put these on, they felt heavy, pushing down on my neck. They were annoyingly shallow. That is to say, for an over-the-ear pair, you'd expect (and want) your ear to fit comfortably within the cushions. Unfortunately, my ear was met by a foam padding that prevented it f ... rom going as far in as it would have liked. That being said, the cushions themselves were rather hard, and the "leather" felt fake and cheap. These are some of the least comfortable headphones I've ever worn.
Sound quality: Well, I just spent 400 dollars on a pair of headphones, so they'd better be amazing quality, right? Well, sadly no. If you're used to a pair o 15 dollar Sony's then yeah, these will sound better. And I think that's a key point. Beat's targets their products to inexperienced teens who don't have anything to base there opinion of quality off. Skullcandy? Forget about it. No comparison. While this is a clever marketing idea, I advise you to think carefully. Try other headphones. Borrow from a friend, listen for an hour or so. You will find that compared with any decent pair of cans, these really aren't anything special. The so called "amazing bass" is blurred and muddy. The highs are sharp and cold, the mid range is okay. While the bass is a strong point, the sound image as a whole is rather obnoxiously high sounding. It's as though someone turned up treble boost so that the mids were blurred, and then randomly added excessive bass. There's no balance at all, little clarity, and not a very good range.
Appearence- Hmm, these are pretty good looking aren't they? I can just imagine it. Being a teenager myself, I have been subject to the ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound. construction.
Cons: Price. Comfort.
Let me start out by saying that these headphones are definitely not for everybody. If the primary genre of music you listen to is rap or hip hop and you're looking to rattle your teeth with bass, move on. These headphones will not satisfy you. I'd recommend the Beats Studios, Sony bass phones, or even the much cheaper 'bass boosted' Skullcandy Skullcrushers for that. However, for every other type of music, it's almost impossible to surpass the sound you get from these. Unless you have experience with headphones costing much more, or a home theatre system consisting of multi-thousand dollar def tech speakers, you will be blown away. The clarity is unbelievable. The highs reached without being overly 'tinny' are unlike any I've h ... eard in other headphones. Subtle nuances in songs you didn't even know were present will be apparent to you with these....for as long as you can manage to keep them on your head. The most prominent drawback to the beats pros is the comfort, er, lack thereof. I personally can only stand to have these on my head for a couple hours at a time before the compression of my ears against my skull becomes overwhelming (even after being broken in!). Because of this, I save the beats for cranking up my favorite tunes and being consumed by the quality of the sound. I put these on when I want to get lost in my music. In other words, these have become special occasion headphones for me. For casual listening I'd much rather just turn on the beatbox when at home, or pop in klipsche earbuds when on the move. As for the construction, I will mimic what almost every other review on this website has said. It's second to none. I feel as though I will have these headphones forever. They feel solid enough to survive years of abuse. Overall, if you can deal with the way the beats pros fit your head, and don't expect pounding lows, you will NOT be disappointed. They have the ability to turn your music into an impressive listening experience. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound, Clarity, Construction, Comfortable (after you find your fit)
Cons: Price is a little too high for what they are...
I have a feeling that you might be paying for that snazzy looking "b" on the side of the headphones in a lot of the 399.99 USD cost.
Where to start, I own some nice IEMs by Klipsch S4, X5 but had never stepped into the high end Over Ear or On Ear headphone category. This could be considered my first foray into the category, but I have auditioned other phones like the Beyerdynamic MT770, Audiotechnica ATH-M50, and the like. And to me the sound is close enough (if not better) on those that 400 USD seems a bit much. The build quality is amazing on these headphones, however, and I believe they might hold up under extensive use compared to other he ... adphones.
The sound is different, and at first I wasn't much for the way my music sounded. However after having listened for 20-ish hours I like it quite a lot. The music is right up front, and sounds quite decent. A tad bit bass heavy, but nothing like the Studios by Dre; in fact to compare the Pros to the Studios is completely impossible the Pros are miles ahead.
I would definitely listen to them first as they might have a little too much bass for some, especially if you are planning on listening to lighter music like acoustic, or classical (but I don't think you are the target audience of these headphones).
Just so you have reference I listen to rock, metal, alt-rock, dubstep, techno, house, drum'n'bass, hip-hop, and a few other similar genres. So my preferences are pretty biased towards a strong punchy bass, and the Beats by Dre Pros deliver on that without crowding out the other sounds! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Monster, Beats By Dr. Dre - Pro Edition
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality, durability, style
Cons: Portability, comfort
I am a very avid listener, I listen 3-8 hours everyday. I have owned 3 pair of Monster Beats, Solo, Studio, and now Pro.
I bought these headphone online because I had a gift card and no Best Buy in my area was in-stock. I ordered 2-day shipping, but Best Buy received the wrong address and I had to change this over the phone (great phone services). After changing the address, the shipping speed changed to 5-7 day shipping and this was permanent. After waiting 7 days to get to my shipping address (California to Arizona) and when I received them, they were in a bag not a box! Worried about them being broken I quickly opened them and thanks to Monsters quality packaging they were fine, but, the box was badly ... bruised and torn. I suggest waiting until a Best Buy in your area is in-stock and buy them online and request store pick-up.
Sound Quality:
The Beats Pro is by-far the best sounding headphones of the Beats' series. They combine clear-punchy bass and defined mids - highs. I can hear an absolute difference between my Beats Studio headphones compared to the Pro edition. With the Studio headphones when no music is playing is the powered noise isolation, this adds an "electrical type sound" to your audio; in fact, this noise can be rather annoying.
Comfortability:
The first two to three days of owning the Beats Pro, the headphones stressed my ears and would have to readjust them every 20 minutes or so. Now after owning these headphones for 2 weeks, these headphones no longer bother me. Also, these headphones are the heaviest headphones that I've ever owned, this takes some getting used to, if you're not a 'frequent headphone wearer.'
Style:
The Monster Beats are famous for their step-up in style compared to headphones of the same price bracket. The Beats Pro headphones from looking at them, whether it be a picture or in store, Monster gave the Beats Pro a new look and feel to them. I appreciate Monster's ingenuity in style with the Pro headphones.
Durability:

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Flexability, durability and phenomenal sound
Cons: The price for the average user.
Ok, first off, I'm no DJ or any kind of professional music person. I'm your average "Joe" who works hard and like to listen to music. I suffer from some hearing loss and can't have the stereo cranked up so load anymore, it annoys my wife and the dogs, who like to join in and bay to the music so, headphones are what I turn to.
These headphones were bought for me as a gift so I really appreciate the thought and bucks that went into them. I have many other headphones to compare these to and will say one thing, the sound output is WAY better than my others. The basses are deep and throbing, the highs are crystal clear with no distortion like some of my other headphones. I was listening ... the "Holtz: The Planets" which was performed by the Boston Symphony Orchestra. It was like sitting in the middle of the 6th row, in a concert hall, fantastic! Next I listened to some acoustic classical guitar, I could hear the artist's fingers slide over the strings and the pick of each string. Again, it was like being in a small cafe, a very intimate experience.
The durability of these headphones is really top notch. The head band is very strong and will not break, in fact the entire construction is so strong, it will stand up to way more abuse than any of my others ever will. The aluminum construction is very strong and yet still light enough so, they can be worn for hours on end.
Now my head is large, I wear a 7 1/2 size hat and I can wear these headphones for hours without getting tired. The noise canceling is very good. I can watch folks having a conversation right in front of me and I can't hear a word they are saying. Now this is very important because, when ever I fly, the dang engine and aircraft sounds drive me nuts but, with these guys on, nothing but pure music of my choosing. I love the detachable, locking cord and the fact that I can choose to attach it either the left or right headphone. Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Almost everything
Cons: Expensive
I would not recommend buying these online without going in to your local best buy to test drive them and compare them to the others. That being said, I love these headphones in contrast to the others. The bass is great but needs to be toned down with a EQ. The Highs are crisp and the Mids come through clearly. People give these a bad rating because they expect to get $1500 studio quality for $400 price tag, period. They are built very well and feel very sturdy.
I listen to everything from Eminem to Disturbed to Alanis Morissette to Mary J. Blidge, so believe me when I say that these headphones sound great with any music. BUT... Remember to adjust the EQ for different styles. a Rap EQ won't sound good for a Rock song because usual ... ly the bass will drown the Mids of the guitars, etc.
The headphone are a bit heavy but, for $400 they better be! They are built like a tank! I usually take a break about 2 hours or so in for 10 minutes then right back at it.
The best thing to me is that these have to be cranked up really really loud to leak. Now if you had the Studios like I did this is a hugh improvement! The Beats Studios leak worse that cheap pampers. But the Pros conceal the music very well.
Overall I love these headphones, but like I said just go to best buy if you can and try them before you buy them. Or check out some videos on youtube that show you some of the qualities. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: The best headphones i've ever used.
Item.Review:
Pros: Best sound quality, extremely comfortable, very well made, one year warranty included, and the professional cord.
Cons: Little Pricey.. But totally worth every penny!
First off, i've owned these headphones for about two weeks, and i couldn't be any happier. The sounds on these is AMAZING! The clarity and attention to detail is unmatched. It's pretty wild hearing background instruments, singing, and/or sounds that you've never heard in songs you have listened too for ages. The bass on these are superb. With bass boost on my iPhone, these headphones really give a sub woofer experience. The next thing i am really impressed with is the craftsmanship. The headphones are made of a high grade aluminum, making them very sturdy, sleek, and not to heavy. The cushioning on the top ... band and the ear cups are really squishy and soft. Another big plus for me is the material doesn't make my ears sweat like previous cloth ear cushions i have used. Lastly. the cord for these headphones is unlike any other cord i have ever seen. It is really long, extremely durable, doesn't tangle, and the audio plugs are reinforced so you can pretty much forget about the inside wires becoming exposed. But what else can you expect from Monster Cable? In my opinion, if you are looking to step your musical experience, whether you are a DJ or an avid listener(like me) and have the money to spend, buy these headphones. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
I tried these out based on the hype, and the name. After all, the person who's name is on these is a world class producer who would be interested in quality sound.
To be succinct, these are not great headphones. They are muddy and indirect. Too heavy on bass, and very sloppy mids. Highs are sharp and tinny.
Essentially, these are 50.00 phones, with great packaging, sexier marketing, and a big name endorsement. I would guarantee that Dr. Dre does not use these headphones as his music listening phones. They are simply not good enough, and over time would ruin a persons ability to hear what is there.
If you are willing to spend 400 on these, then I would recommend saving an extra 100 and look at some of the better Sennheisers, or lower end Beyerdynamics.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: These are great if you want deep extended bass
Item.Review:
Pros: Quality construction
Cons: Like all Monster products somewhat overpriced
These oftentimes get bad reviews from audiophiles. I dont think thats fair. They are great headphones if you want extended bass. Very well made and they do reduce much of the outside noise you encounter. Are they perfectly balanced, no but neither are most other headphones. I have Senn 600 and 650's and Denon 7000 all of which are much higher rated but I enjoy the Beats just as much depending on my mood/music/location. They are easy to drive and both my Zunes and Ipods can easily drive them. While I admit they sound better with a external headphone amp one is not really needed. If your taste is towards heavy bass you will love these.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Build Quality, Sound, Bass
Cons: Brand Name, Price
I don't like to equate myself as an audiophile, but I do critically listen to music both at home and outside of the home. Recently, I've listened to a good handful of headphones, high priced and lower priced, and none of them allowed me to enjoy the music as I did with the Beats Pros.
I am not a big fan of name-brand labeling, nor do I necessarily care for endorsements from celebrities either. So Dr. Dre's name stamp on this product means little to me; moreover, I care less about the Monster name brand. What I do care about is the style overall and the build quality. Aside from having Dre's name I think these are some of the nicest looking headphones I've seen. They feel nice as well, however having tried other h ... eadphones out -- Shure, Denon, Pioneer, Audio Technica, and Grado -- the Beats are the style most appealing to me. The metal gives these a sturdy feel, albeit heavier than most headphones, and don't feel flimsy or cheap to me.
As for the sound quality, these are fantastic. They are not the best sounding headphones I've tested, but as I said in the beginning, they are the ones that allowed to enjoy the music the most. To a critically tuned ear, there are more detailed and airy headphones out there and there are headphones that have a bigger frequency range, but these sure impressed me still. Obviously, the reason to want these are for the bass reproduction. The midrange is not quite as pronouced as most others I tried, and the highs didn't quite sparkle as other headphones, but they also aren't as fatiguing to listen to as some other cans I tried. spatial sound stage is good, although it never appears to go beyond the headphones, like several of the other headphones I tried. But, as I said, these headphones allowed me to enjoy the music. I would give these a sound rating of 8.5/10, overall.
As a whole, these headphones produce a sound that is worthwhile for me to keep. The price point is very steep, but that's the price you have to pay for the name brand a ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Meant for studio and for stereo use, not mp3 use
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality, durability, dj and studio features are perfect
Cons: not as high quality items included in package
Seriously people, if your thinking about buying these headphones you must buy them for studio and stereo use, i'll tell you why in a few seconds. I'm just going to say that these headphones are just amazing with sound quality(if you use it with the right machines). The bass is very powerful, but is rich and defined without being overpowering to the other frequencies. Mid bass is great, not as good as the low bass, but better than the mids. The mids are a little lacking but your not going to notice because the bass and mid bass make up for it. The treble was just unbelievably clear and crisp without being sharp, which surprised me for bass intensive headphone ... s. The reason why you cant use these with a mp3 player is because the mp3 player can not put out enough power to actually power these headphones, and if you do use them with an mp3 player you'll find that they are as bad sounding as skullcandy's. These just take up to much power for the mp3 player to sustain for more than 10 minutes, the mp3 player will put out as much as it allows itself to but no more, which really cuts back on the quality of sound. THe comfort is ok, it doesn't hurt but it sits slightly on the ear making it kind of awkward when compared to the studios. Also they are very heavy, but if your a tolerant person then you should be fine. Although this is huge improvement durability wise when compared to the studios, these headphones are very thick and durable, also made out of aluminum so you could throw them around(but why would you with such high priced headphones). I am kind of disappointed with what comes in the package with these headphones, i mean the carrying case is just a little pouch, nothing compared to the studios hard shell case. Also there is only one cord, but it is replaceable like always so you can fix it if needed. Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Went from a pair of Denon AHD-1001K to this, WOW
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quility, durability.
Cons: nothing yet
So up until a few days ago I had a pair of Denon AHD-1001K, 150 dollar headphones from denon. I had always been impressed with how clean and accurate the bass was on them. The only thing I hated about the Denons was that I got fatigued from the highs after about 30-45 mins of music listening. Couple things i've noticed from reading reviews on the Beats Pro headphones. People DO NOT understand what music is supposed to sound like. People seem to think the bass MUST rattle your house, and highs must burn your ears out. This is never the case. I would take a set of headphones that were not bass heavy, over a set that was, if the bass on the first set was cleaner than the second set. Now, the highs on these headphones are great, ... I have been using them today for near 4 hours straight with no ear fatigue. Also the bass has been great. I would also like to point out that I have maybe 10 hours listening into these headphones, and so they are not fully burned in yet(somewhere between 35-45 hours seems to be a normal on cans for burn in.)
I also am happy about the aluminum design. The denons were all plastic, and I actually broke one pair. Also the ear covers are very easy to take off and put on, a nice welcome over the denons where I had to spend time, tucking the liner around the plastic base. Also, something Bose does, that I LOVE, the only thing Bose does that I LOVE, is the cable disconnects at the headphones, so if you break the cable, you can replace it! Always hated that about the denons, and is the reason I had to replace them.
I had also had the beat studios and was very unimpressed. They don't have the same cleanliness of these headphones, probably because they use noise cancellation tech. You always get reduced sound quality with this. I also hated the fact that the studios sit on your ears and not over them. Something I grew very used to from the denons.
I would also like to point out, for the people I have seen complaining about no iphone cable, and no protec ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality, durability, style, dual input/output ports
Cons: Price, comfort is somewhat lacking
The Beats Pros sound fantastic -- though perhaps a tad bit bass-heavy. They leak sound, though not nearly as much as the Studios or the Solos. Stay under 70% volume and you should be ok.
Lets also get this out of the way. Beats are overpriced. Everybody who works in audio will tell you this. In fact, you could probably get similar sound out of headphones in the $200-$250 range.
So why Beats?
Aesthetics and build quality. Beats Pro are the most aesthetically pleasing pair of headphones I've seen in a long time. They aren't glossy like the Studios, so no worries when it comes to fingerprints. The Pros still come with a Monster fiber cleaning cloth, howev ... er. Also, the earpieces are washable (the Monster instruction manual says to only do this seldomly)
The Pros are also durable (for the most part) -- a first for the Beats series. Everything up until the Pros (the Studios, Solos, etc) have had so-so build quality. The complete metal body of the Beats Pros is a huge plus, though they are somewhat heavy. The headphones also come with a red Monster connection cord (thick, will never tangle) and a thin, soft-shell carrying case
Now, my head is fairly large (though not huge) and the Pros apply pressure that just surpasses the realm of comfort. If you plan on listening to your music for more than an hour or two at a time, you may need to take breaks in between, for your head's sake.
In the end, the Beats Pro headphones are... well, 'satisfying'. The dual input-output ports are an extremely cool feature -- as is the swivel 'DJ' design. Unfortunately, the $350-$450 price on the headset prevents me from giving these headsets a 5-star review. Again, you can find similar sound quality around the $250 range, just do not expect pleasing aesthetics or excellent build quality.
iPOD OWNERS, READ HERE: Unlike the Studio's, the Pros are not battery powered - which mean that they take power away from your iPod/MP3 player. While the Pros will work just fine with the iPod Touch and i ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Awsome beats for the casual listener
Item.Review:
Pros: durable, dont need to be amp'd, alot of bass, decent sound quality
Cons: eq'd bass, price is a little high, strange exchangeable input/output ports
Let me start off by saying that the reason the sound quality is only a 3/5* is because these phones are eq'd. The bass is jacked way up and mids and highs are a bit low. So if you are doing any music editing, these are not a good choice for you.
Now with that out of the way, there is a significant increase in quality over the beats: studio. Metal brushed parts add weight and make these cans feel very sturdy. The optional 1/4" plug is also a plus. For all you rap/r&b, techno, or dubstep listeners out there; these phones will hit you hard with the bass your probably looking for. Comfort wise, these are mediocre. The ... y have nice beg pads that just about go all the way around the ear, but there is a squeezing pressure that might agitate some like me with a bigger head.
I have tested these phones both amp'd (Headroom Ultra Desktop) and un-amp'd through a ipod or computer 3.5mm jack. Even with the ipod these guys still played very nicely. All in all, Monster Beats Pro by Dr Dre may not be the best choice for a individual looking for neutral headphones, but to the casual listener, they will supply a bass rich environment to please the ears. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: Please educate yourself on audio first
Item.Review:
Pros: style and strong bass (albeit overly strong)
Cons: build quality, requires battery, mid-range and high-range, overly colored sound
I write this review to forewarn you about Beats By Dre, by Monster, as a brand and headphone line. While they are nice sounding headphones, compared to other headphones in the same price range made by truly reputable long running headphone makers, these fall short sound quality-wise. (AKG, Grado, Sennheisers that cost more than $200, Audio-Technica, Sony Studio Pros)
On a scale of 1-10 these would rate about a 6.5 or 7. Most people are used to your run-of-the-mill department store headphones (skullcandy, sony, white apple earbuds, etc) and compared to those, these sound worlds better, however if you compared these to truly good headph ... ones then you'd hear what you're missing. These have a good bass response but are lacking elsewhere.
These are just highly marketed to a specific segment of the population to fool you into thinking you're getting the best money can buy. Don't believe the hype. Read a reputable headphone/audio forum, such as head-fi or audioholics, and you'll see the overwhelming negative opinions by people who both, KNOW audio and don't fall for the marketing and peer blitz.
If bass and style is all you care about, and over spending for headphones is your thing, then go ahead and get them. If you want the best sound for the price and don't care about style and image then you can get comparably sounding headphones for less, probably half as much. This is a good article that'll explain it more: http://2011/07/headphone-popularity.html expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.ReviewTitle: These are NOT studio or professional headphones.
Item.Review:
Pros: Super Durable
Cons: Uncomfortable, Sub par Sound Quality, Price.
When looking at this product as a potential buy, I was intrigued by the claim that these are designed for studio use, and that the headphones would deliver accurate tones when editing and mixing in the studio. When I first used them it was with my iPod, and I can assure you that if this was their primary function, and if that's what you're looking for in these headphones, then you should buy them right now. I was blown away by how crisp the songs from my iPod sounded, as if it was the first time I had ever heard the songs. Needless to say, I was itching to use them in the studio. However, when I began using these for such a purpose, it slowly dawned on me that while these headphones are great for casual li ... stening, they have some CRITICAL flaws which make them hard, if not downright impossible (for me anyway) to use for anything other than what I already had done. The sound quality in the studio, which is claimed to be fantastic, is lacking in several ways: first, they have way to much bass to be able to use well in a studio, and I found that as I was using them, no matter what I tried in the mixer or EQ the bass was too overwhelming to accurately depict what I was recording. Second, the mid and high end frequencies are completely overpowered by the amount of bass in these headphones, making for an unbalanced frequency range that can be crippling when mixing and mastering. Third, the rotating ear-cups, which is a nifty idea in theory, actually made some low frequency buzzing because of the imprecise way the aluminum frame was milled and put together. While accurate sound in the studio is my number one concern when purchasing headphones at this price range, comfort is about a micrometer below that on the scale of what I want in a headphone. And these 'phones are AWFUL. They are EXTREMELY TIGHT, and left me with a splitting headache after an hour and a half of use. If you wear earrings, forget about wearing them while using these for a good while; the small plastic .12 ... expand » « collapse

I have had a home studio for approx. 6 years. I'm constantly looking and trying find products that produce high quailty studio sound. I am a musician, and sound engineer, and most of the time, never satitisfied with the sound that I hear. I purchased the Phones just the other day. I had first thought of the Bose headphones, which really sounded nice, but I wanted something with more KICK, and maticulous discreet sound. I was able to compare the two and our local store, and was totally BLOWN AWAY with the difference in clarity and precise tones I had spent years looking for. Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Clear sound with lots of bass, metal construction, curved detachable cord, cups can slide up, very attractive looking
Cons: a bit pricey, comfort level is not bad, but nothing spectacular
I've been DJ'ing for over 20 years and the Beat Pro's are the best pair of headphones that I've ever used for DJ'ing. The sound quality is really good. Very clear sound with lots of bass. The bass is what really separates these headphones from the sound of other high end models. Over the years I've had trouble with the plastic parts on my DJ headphones cracking from folding them up when going to the club. The Beats Pro are made out of metal so they won't crack like most other DJ headphones (Pioneer 2000 are also made out of metal). Another feature that I like is that the detachable cor ... d has an end that is curved. What that means for DJ's is that the end of the cord that plugs into your DJ mixer doesn't stick straight up and get in the way when your DJ'ing (when using mixers that have the headphone jack on top of the board). Because it's curved, it stays out of the way. The comfort level of these headphones is pretty standard. I also find the white headphones to be unique and very attractive. These headphones are pricey, but not if you're a serious DJ. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White

These headphones are the best I've ever had by far. I play basketball so before a game I listen to my music and these headphones allow me to focus. Very good build, love the flip cups, really stylish, just great all around. Dre knocked it out of the ball park with these. Great job

Item.Item: Monster Beats Pro High Performance Professional Headphones From Monster Pro-tuned Over-Ear - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - White
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound, Build Quality
Cons: Price
This is my best attempt at writing an unbiased review for these headphones. I was a little concerned with the price tag for these babies. However, I have not been disappointed by my purchase. There are many who complain about Beats' sound. Honestly, unless you're a hardcore audiophile I really don't see any way that you could say that these sound anything besides excellent. The bass is there when you want it and is booming, no disappointments, the mids are pronounced and clear while not being overpowered by the bass, and the highs are bright and crisp without being tinny. Also, there has been concern that iPods cannot power these headphones. This is false. My iTouch does it just fine. Another factor to consider is sound leakage. The Pros ... leak quite a bit of sound so just be aware of that if you are in public and are rocking out to Ke$ha. On a final note, the build quality is spectacular. A HUGE improvement from the studios (which I would not buy because they were so fragile). So if you have the money buy these and you will not be disappointed. I guarantee it. expand » « collapse

Cons: Price
The wait is over!!! Having used multiple different types of headphones in my life I have yet to find anything that is in near comparison with the Beats Pros. All the way from lows to highs you honestly feel like you are in the studio with the artist. They don't have noise canceling, but I can't hear anything but music when I have them on. The ability to have flip cups is almost a necessity, so that you can hear other things around you. I use these primarily for doing homework and watching movies on my computer. With having loud roommates it is very nice to drown them out while doing homework. As far as comfort there is nothing that is even close. While I laid in bed with the studios I was always afraid that I was going ... to snap them in half, but the construction on the Pros is awesome very lightweight yet they feel like they can take a beating with out a problem. I would highly recommend these to anyone who is seriously looking at upgrading your headphones. expand » « collapse

The case is small and easy to carry, but has no place for the headphone chord also the carrying case is not a very strong case... it is only a small leather bag, and you cannot fully put your beats in the case there will always be a little bit of the headband you can see. overall they are a great pair of headphones they do what they are supposed to do
